reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a surprise to find a hotel of this standard in the quiet little village of Bouin. We were here for one night and had the most amazing room - big enough to have a party in! The restaurant was very good with interesting choices. Breakfast was also of a high standard. A super place to stay. A quiet location, just what we wanted.
reviews.title: Unexpected find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main reason to stay in Bouin is to watch the tide at the near-by Passage de Groix. Ask for a room in the garden, by the pool, and don't miss the restaurant.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very quite environment. Very friendly owners with ambitian to further improve. The hotel has an excellent restaurant with changing dishes if you stay for a longer time. We did like very much the food that was served. Rooms are basic but have everything you need. Could sleep excellent (good mattress). Enough parking available and the free WiFi did work properly.
reviews.title: Excellent price/quality

reviews.text: At the end of a three day trip I was looking forward to a good hotel and was not disappointed. The outside of the hotel was attractive on a little lane in Bouin. Once inside it was clear the old hotel had undergone recent refurbishment- the rooms were big and comfortable- big enough for three (although I was one) and a nice bathroom with a walk-in shower. The restaurant is next door in a 17century barn - not that cheap but seriously good food. Overall great value in an undiscovered part of the French coast.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Looking for a hotel at the coast of Nantes/Poitou I had two important demands: it had to be child friendly (ak swimming pool) and had to be charming as we didn't want to end up in a prefab, concrete tourist trap. Le Martinet met both demands. The room was very basic, but what else do you need when travelling with children. At first we got a room near the restaurant whose ventilation kept us awake all night, but the management changed our room immidiately after complaning. The whole setting of the hotel was really wonderful and charming and service were absolutely excellent! The small town of Bouin might be very quiet to some people but more vivid towns are only a few minutes away by car. I could recommend this hotel to anybody!
reviews.title: excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A special place to unwind in the tranquil atmosphere of this region. Unhurried, and polite staff with excellent restaurant facilities on site. The garden and pool area invite you to spend time either in the heated pool or under the shade of mature trees. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Great value overall! Would be a lovely venue for a wedding celebration too.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm
